cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENTPrinted for the War Cabinet. January 1942.SECRET. Copy No. 44W.M. (42)6th Conclusions.TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document.WAR CABINET 6 (42).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10 Downing Street,S.W. 1, on Wednesday, January 14, 1942, at 7 p.m.PresentThe Right Hon. C. R. Attlee, M.P., Lord Privy Seal (in the Chair).The Right Hon. Sir John Anderson,M.P., Lord President of the Council.The Right Hon. A. Greenwood, M.P.,Minister without Portfolio.The Right Hon. Anthony Eden, M.P.,Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.The Right Hon. Sir Kingsley Wood,M.P., Chancellor of the Exchequer.The Right Hon. Ebnest Bevin, M.P.,Minister of Labour and NationalService.The following were also presentThe Right Hon. Viscount Cranborne,Secretary of State for dominion the Right Hon. A. V. Alexander,M.P., First Lord of the Admiralty.Affairs.Captain the Right Hon. H. D. 1 The Right Hon. Sir ArchibaldMargesson, M.P., Secretary of State j Sinclair, Bt., M.P., Secretary offor War. ! State for Air.Sir Orme Sargent, Deputy Under-Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.Sir Edward Bridges, Secretary.St. Pierre and The War Cabinet were informed by the Foreign Secretary ofMiquelon. the upShot of his discussions with General de Gaulle, and of the(Previous latest developments in the situation.Reference :w.m. (42) 5th A record of the discussion, and of the Conclusions reached,Conclusions, is contained in the Secretary's Standard File of War cabinet minute l.) Conclusions.Great George Street, S.W. 1,January 14, 1942.[23346-2]
